overview_of_class: This course will introduce students to research methods used in psychology. Through readings, lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will learn about the process of scientific investigation and about the analysis and interpretation of research data. Students will participate in three research projects and will write a report on each in the style used by research psychologists (APA). Primary goals of the course are to have students effectively communicate the findings of their own research and critically evaluate the research of others.
name: Research Methods in Psychology
title: WCAS PSYCH 205-0-25 Research Methods in Psychology

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: PSYCH 110 or equivalent AND Psych 201-Statistical Methods. Department consent required.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation Method: Grades will be based on two in-class essay exams, two short papers, and completion of 3 APA style research reports.
